mnemonic: FALAR = FAL-AR - FALL into a conversation!
grammar_notes: -AR is the most common verb ending. Remove -ar add endings.
cultural_note: Portuguese love to 'falar' - conversation is a national pastime!
tip: Most common -AR verb - base for conjugation

mnemonic: EU FALO = I FALL-o into speaking!
grammar_notes: Remove -ar add -o for 'eu'. All -AR verbs follow this.
cultural_note: 'Falo um pouco de português' - a humble way to start!

mnemonic: TU FALAS = you FALL-as into talking!
grammar_notes: Remove -ar add -as for 'tu'. The 's' marks informal you.
cultural_note: In Porto 'Tu falas português?' is more common than 'Você fala?'

mnemonic: ELE FALA = he FALL-a into chat!
grammar_notes: Remove -ar add -a for ele/ela/você. Same ending for all three.
cultural_note: 'Ele fala pelos cotovelos' (he talks through his elbows) = talks too much!
'Falamos português' is often said with pride by Portuguese!

mnemonic: ELES FALAM = they FALL-am into group chat!
grammar_notes: Remove -ar add -am for eles/elas. Plural marker.
cultural_note: 'Eles falam muito rápido' - Portuguese speech can be fast!

mnemonic: TRABALHAR = tra-BALL-yar - work like juggling BALLS!
grammar_notes: Regular -AR verb. 'Lh' sounds like 'ly' in million.
cultural_note: Portuguese work culture values 'almoço' - lunch break is sacred!

mnemonic: EU TRABALHO = I tra-BALL-yo at my job!
cultural_note: 'Trabalho em casa' (I work from home) became very common!

mnemonic: GOSTAR DE = GOSH I like that!
grammar_notes: Always followed by 'de'. 'Gosto de' (I like) 'Gostas de?' (Do you like?).
cultural_note: 'Gosto muito de' (I really like) shows enthusiasm!

grammar_notes: For residence location. Use 'viver' for existence.
cultural_note: 'Onde mora?' (Where do you live?) is a common getting-to-know-you question.

mnemonic: ESTUDAR = es-STUD-ar - be a STUD at studying!
cultural_note: Portuguese universities are highly respected - Coimbra is one of oldest in Europe!

mnemonic: COMPRAR = com-PRAR - COMPARE before you buy!
cultural_note: 'Comprar peixe fresco' (buy fresh fish) - markets are cultural hubs!
